title: Kedarkantha
subtitle: A beginner-friendly winter summit
about: Kedarkantha is a short, sharply-rewarding trek famous for its snow-clad forests, rolling meadows and a dawn summit that delivers 360° views of Uttarakhand’s high ranges. Comfortable campsites and well-defined trails make it one of India’s most popular winter climbs for beginners and small groups.
seo_description: Short winter trek in Uttarakhand with sunrise summit and sweeping snow views. Ideal for first-time snow trekkers.

trek_places.name: Sankri Village
trek_places.about: Sankri is a lively village that acts as the starting point for Kedarkantha and neighboring treks. It provides basic accommodation, rental gear shops and local eateries. Trekkers use Sankri to acclimatize and meet guides before the trail head.
what_to_do: Check permits and hire local guide
Stock up on supplies and rent winter gear
Walk the village lanes and photograph local life

trek_places.name: Juda Ka Talab
trek_places.about: Juda Ka Talab is a photogenic campsite where the lake freezes in winter and pine trees frame the camp. It’s the first real snow experience for many trekkers and a calm place to stargaze.
what_to_do: Walk around the frozen lake edge
Enjoy a calm evening campfire under clear skies

trek_places.name: Kedarkantha Base Camp
trek_places.short: Open snowfield below the summit ridge
trek_places.about: The base camp sits on a wide snow meadow with panoramic views of the ridge and the peaks beyond. It’s the last rest stop before the pre-dawn summit push, offering a dramatic foreground for sunrise photography.
what_to_do: Prepare packs and hydrate for summit day
Capture golden hour and night-sky photos
Rest and check equipment with guides

trek_places.name: Kedarkantha Summit
trek_places.short: A dramatic sunrise viewpoint above the clouds
trek_places.about: The summit rewards trekkers with a near-360° panorama of Himalayan giants like Swargarohini and Bandarpoonch. The ascent is steep but short; the summit is the emotional peak of the trek.
what_to_do: Watch and photograph sunrise over the ranges
Relax and take in the 360° panorama
Use the summit for short reflection/meditation
